content:
Sure, here are some other greens that tend to stay fresh for extended periods of time:

1. Iceberg lettuce - This classic lettuce variety stays fresh for up to two weeks when stored in the fridge.

2. Cabbage - Cabbage can last up to two weeks when stored in the fridge, and can be used in a variety of salads and slaws.

3. Spring mix - This pre-packaged salad mix usually contains a mix of baby lettuces and greens, and stays fresh for up to five days when stored in the fridge.

4. Radicchio - This red leafy vegetable can last up to two weeks when stored in a container with a damp paper towel.

5. Chard - This leafy green can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

6. Beet greens - The greens that come with fresh beets can last up to a week when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

7. Escarole - This slightly bitter leafy green can last up to a week when stored in a container with a damp paper towel.

8. Mizuna - This Japanese green has a mild, slightly peppery flavor and can last up to four days when stored in the fridge.

Just like with the previous list, these recommended times are just rough estimates and depend on factors like the freshness of the produce, storage conditions, and humidity levels.
